title: Jephthah’s Vow and Victory
summary: Judges 11 introduces Jephthah, a mighty warrior rejected by his family. He is later asked to lead Israel against the Ammonites. He makes a tragic vow to sacrifice whatever comes out of his house if God gives him victory—and ends up sacrificing his daughter.

faq.question: Who was Jephthah?
faq.answer: A rejected son of a prostitute who became Israel’s deliverer against Ammon.

faq.question: What vow did he make to God?
faq.answer: He promised to sacrifice the first thing that came out of his house if he won the battle.
